segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers

segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers

segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on Distributed Servers

segment.source: The procedures in this topic describe how to install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 in the Stand-alone topology on distributed servers.
segment.target: The procedures in this topic describe how to install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 in the Stand-alone topology on distributed servers.

segment.source: To see a diagram of the recommended architecture, along with a description of the databases and features, see Deploying the MBAM 2.0 Server Infrastructure.
segment.target: To see a diagram of the recommended architecture, along with a description of the databases and features, see Deploying the MBAM 2.0 Server Infrastructure.

segment.source: To install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with the Configuration Manager topology, see Deploying MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: To install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with the Configuration Manager topology, see Deploying MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Each server feature has certain prerequisites.
segment.target: Each server feature has certain prerequisites.

segment.source: To verify that you have met the prerequisites and hardware and software requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: To verify that you have met the prerequisites and hardware and software requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Deployment Prerequisites and MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: In addition, some features require that you provide certain information during the installation process to successfully deploy the feature.
segment.target: In addition, some features require that you provide certain information during the installation process to successfully deploy the feature.

segment.source: You should also review Planning for MBAM 2.0 Server Deployment before you start the MBAM deployment.
segment.target: You should also review Planning for MBAM 2.0 Server Deployment before you start the MBAM deployment.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To obtain the setup log files, you have to use the Msiexec package and the /Llocation option to install MBAM.
segment.target: To obtain the setup log files, you have to use the Msiexec package and the /Llocation option to install MBAM.

segment.source: Log files are created in the location that you specify.
segment.target: Log files are created in the location that you specify.

segment.source: Additional setup log files are created in the %temp% folder on the server of the user who is installing MBAM.
segment.target: Additional setup log files are created in the %temp% folder on the server of the user who is installing MBAM.

segment.source: Deploying MBAM Server Features
segment.target: Deploying MBAM Server Features

segment.source: The following steps describe how to install general MBAM features.
segment.target: The following steps describe how to install general MBAM features.

segment.source: To start the MBAM Server installation wizard
segment.target: To start the MBAM Server installation wizard

segment.source: On the server where you want to install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring, run MBAMSetup.exe to start the MBAM installation wizard.
segment.target: On the server where you want to install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring, run MBAMSetup.exe to start the MBAM installation wizard.

segment.source: On the Welcome page, optionally select the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Start.
segment.target: On the Welcome page, optionally select the Customer Experience Improvement Program, and then click Start.

segment.source: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.
segment.target: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Agreement, and then click Next to continue the installation.

segment.source: On the Topology Selection page, select the Stand-alone topology, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Topology Selection page, select the Stand-alone topology, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you want to install MBAM with the Configuration Manager integrated topology, see Deploying MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: If you want to install MBAM with the Configuration Manager integrated topology, see Deploying MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Select the features that you want to install.
segment.target: Select the features that you want to install.

segment.source: By default, all MBAM features are selected for installation.
segment.target: By default, all MBAM features are selected for installation.

segment.source: Clear the features that you want to install elsewhere.
segment.target: Clear the features that you want to install elsewhere.

segment.source: Features that will be installed on the same computer must be installed together at the same time.
segment.target: Features that will be installed on the same computer must be installed together at the same time.

segment.source: You must install MBAM features in the following order:
segment.target: You must install MBAM features in the following order:

segment.source: Recovery Database
segment.target: Recovery Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: Self-Service Portal
segment.target: Self-Service Portal

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Server
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Server

segment.source: MBAM Group Policy template
segment.target: MBAM Group Policy template

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The installation wizard checks the prerequisites for your installation and displays the prerequisites that are missing.
segment.target: The installation wizard checks the prerequisites for your installation and displays the prerequisites that are missing.

segment.source: If all of the prerequisites are met, the installation continues.
segment.target: If all of the prerequisites are met, the installation continues.

segment.source: If a missing prerequisite is detected, you have to resolve the missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.
segment.target: If a missing prerequisite is detected, you have to resolve the missing prerequisites, and then click Check prerequisites again.

segment.source: If all prerequisites are met this time, the installation resumes.
segment.target: If all prerequisites are met this time, the installation resumes.

segment.source: The MBAM Setup wizard displays installation pages for the features that you select.
segment.target: The MBAM Setup wizard displays installation pages for the features that you select.

segment.source: The following sections describe the installation procedures for each feature.
segment.target: The following sections describe the installation procedures for each feature.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For the following instructions, it is assumed that each feature is to be installed on a separate server.
segment.target: For the following instructions, it is assumed that each feature is to be installed on a separate server.

segment.source: If you install multiple features on a single server, you can change or eliminate some steps.
segment.target: If you install multiple features on a single server, you can change or eliminate some steps.

segment.source: To install the Recovery Database
segment.target: To install the Recovery Database

segment.source: On the Configure the Recovery database page, specify the names of the computers that will be running the Administration and Monitoring Server feature.
segment.target: On the Configure the Recovery database page, specify the names of the computers that will be running the Administration and Monitoring Server feature.

segment.source: After the Administration and Monitoring Server feature is deployed, it uses its domain account to connect to the database.
segment.target: After the Administration and Monitoring Server feature is deployed, it uses its domain account to connect to the database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the recovery data.
segment.target: Specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the recovery data.

segment.source: You must also specify both where the database will be located and where the log information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify both where the database will be located and where the log information will be located.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the MBAM Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: To install the Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Database page, specify the user account that will be used to access the database for reports.
segment.target: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Database page, specify the user account that will be used to access the database for reports.

segment.source: Specify the computer names of the computers that will be running the Administration and Monitoring Server and the Compliance and Audit Reports.
segment.target: Specify the computer names of the computers that will be running the Administration and Monitoring Server and the Compliance and Audit Reports.

segment.source: After the Administration and Monitoring and the Compliance and Audit Reports Server are deployed, they use their domain accounts to connect to the databases.
segment.target: After the Administration and Monitoring and the Compliance and Audit Reports Server are deployed, they use their domain accounts to connect to the databases.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are installing the Compliance and Audit Database without the Compliance and Audit Reports feature, you must add an exception on the Compliance and Audit Database computer to enable inbound traffic on the Microsoft SQL Server port.
segment.target: If you are installing the Compliance and Audit Database without the Compliance and Audit Reports feature, you must add an exception on the Compliance and Audit Database computer to enable inbound traffic on the Microsoft SQL Server port.

segment.source: The default port number is 1433.
segment.target: The default port number is 1433.

segment.source: Specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the compliance and audit data.
segment.target: Specify the SQL Server instance name and the name of the database that will store the compliance and audit data.

segment.source: You must also specify where the database and log information will be located.
segment.target: You must also specify where the database and log information will be located.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: To install the Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Reports page, specify the remote SQL Server instance name (for example, ServerName) where the Compliance and Audit Database was installed.
segment.target: On the Configure the Compliance and Audit Reports page, specify the remote SQL Server instance name (for example, ServerName) where the Compliance and Audit Database was installed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are installing the Compliance and Audit Reports without the Administration and Monitoring Server, you must add an exception on the Compliance and Audit Report computer to enable inbound traffic on the Reporting Server port (the default port is 80).
segment.target: If you are installing the Compliance and Audit Reports without the Administration and Monitoring Server, you must add an exception on the Compliance and Audit Report computer to enable inbound traffic on the Reporting Server port (the default port is 80).

segment.source: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status, although you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status, although you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Select the instance of SQL Server Reporting Services where the Compliance and Audit Reports will be installed.
segment.target: Select the instance of SQL Server Reporting Services where the Compliance and Audit Reports will be installed.

segment.source: Provide a domain user account and password to access the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Provide a domain user account and password to access the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Configure the password for this account to never expire.
segment.target: Configure the password for this account to never expire.

segment.source: The user account should be able to access all data that is available to the MBAM Reports Users group.
segment.target: The user account should be able to access all data that is available to the MBAM Reports Users group.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: To install the Self-Service Portal
segment.target: To install the Self-Service Portal

segment.source: On the Configure the Self-Service Portal page, you can optionally encrypt the communication between the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: On the Configure the Self-Service Portal page, you can optionally encrypt the communication between the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: If you choose the option to encrypt the communication, you are prompted to select the certification authority-provisioned certificate to use for encryption.
segment.target: If you choose the option to encrypt the communication, you are prompted to select the certification authority-provisioned certificate to use for encryption.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example, ServerName) where the Compliance and Audit Database was installed.
segment.target: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example, ServerName) where the Compliance and Audit Database was installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status.

segment.source: However, you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: However, you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example, ServerName) where the Recovery Database was installed.
segment.target: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example, ServerName) where the Recovery Database was installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Recovery Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware.

segment.source: However, you can change the name when you install the Recovery Database feature.
segment.target: However, you can change the name when you install the Recovery Database feature.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Enter the Port Number, the Host Name (optional), and the Installation Path for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: Enter the Port Number, the Host Name (optional), and the Installation Path for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring server unless you specify a unique host header name.
segment.target: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring server unless you specify a unique host header name.

segment.source: If you are using Windows Firewall, the port will be opened automatically.
segment.target: If you are using Windows Firewall, the port will be opened automatically.

segment.source: To optionally register a Service Principal Name (SPN) for the Self-Service Portal, select Register this machine’s Service Principal Names (SPN) with Active Directory (Required for Windows Authentication).
segment.target: To optionally register a Service Principal Name (SPN) for the Self-Service Portal, select Register this machine’s Service Principal Names (SPN) with Active Directory (Required for Windows Authentication).

segment.source: If you select this check box, MBAM Setup will not try to register the existing SPNs, and you can manually register the SPN before or after the MBAM installation.
segment.target: If you select this check box, MBAM Setup will not try to register the existing SPNs, and you can manually register the SPN before or after the MBAM installation.

segment.source: For instructions on registering the SPN manually, see Manual SPN Registration.
segment.target: For instructions on registering the SPN manually, see Manual SPN Registration.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.

segment.source: When the selected MBAM feature information is completed, you are ready to start the MBAM installation by using the Setup wizard.
segment.target: When the selected MBAM feature information is completed, you are ready to start the MBAM installation by using the Setup wizard.

segment.source: Click Back to move through the wizard if you have to review or change your installation settings.
segment.target: Click Back to move through the wizard if you have to review or change your installation settings.

segment.source: Click Install to start the installation.
segment.target: Click Install to start the installation.

segment.source: Click Cancel to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Click Cancel to exit the wizard.

segment.source: Setup installs the MBAM features that you selected and notifies you that the installation is finished.
segment.target: Setup installs the MBAM features that you selected and notifies you that the installation is finished.

segment.source: Click Finish to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Click Finish to exit the wizard.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To configure the Self-Service Portal after you installed it, brand the Self-Service Portal with your company name and other company-specific information, see How to Brand the Self-Service Portal for instructions.
segment.target: To configure the Self-Service Portal after you installed it, brand the Self-Service Portal with your company name and other company-specific information, see How to Brand the Self-Service Portal for instructions.

segment.source: If the client computers have access to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN), which gives the Self-Service Portal the required access to certain JavaScript files, you are finished with the Self-Service Portal installation.
segment.target: If the client computers have access to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN), which gives the Self-Service Portal the required access to certain JavaScript files, you are finished with the Self-Service Portal installation.

segment.source: If the client computers does not have access to the Microsoft CDN, complete the steps in the next section to configure the Self-Service Portal to reference the JavaScript files from an accessible source.
segment.target: If the client computers does not have access to the Microsoft CDN, complete the steps in the next section to configure the Self-Service Portal to reference the JavaScript files from an accessible source.

segment.source: To configure the Self-Service Portal when end users cannot access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network
segment.target: To configure the Self-Service Portal when end users cannot access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network

segment.source: If the client computers have access to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN), which gives the Self-Service Portal the required access to certain JavaScript files, the Self-Service Portal installation is completed.
segment.target: If the client computers have access to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network (CDN), which gives the Self-Service Portal the required access to certain JavaScript files, the Self-Service Portal installation is completed.

segment.source: If the client computers do not have access to the Microsoft CDN, complete the remaining steps in this section to configure the Self-Service Portal to reference the JavaScript files from an accessible source.
segment.target: If the client computers do not have access to the Microsoft CDN, complete the remaining steps in this section to configure the Self-Service Portal to reference the JavaScript files from an accessible source.

segment.source: Download the four JavaScript files from the Microsoft CDN:
segment.target: Download the four JavaScript files from the Microsoft CDN:

segment.source: jQuery-1.7.2.min.js - http://go.microsoft.com/p/fwlink/?LinkID=271736
segment.target: jQuery-1.7.2.min.js - http://go.microsoft.com/p/fwlink/?LinkID=271736

segment.source: MicrosoftAjax.js –http://go.microsoft.com/p/fwlink/?LinkId=272283
segment.target: MicrosoftAjax.js –http://go.microsoft.com/p/fwlink/?LinkId=272283

segment.source: MicrosoftMvcAjax.js - http://go.microsoft.com/p/fwlink/?LinkId=272284
segment.target: MicrosoftMvcAjax.js - http://go.microsoft.com/p/fwlink/?LinkId=272284

segment.source: MicrosoftMvcValidation.js - http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=272285
segment.target: MicrosoftMvcValidation.js - http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=272285

segment.source: Copy the JavaScript files to the Scripts directory of the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: Copy the JavaScript files to the Scripts directory of the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: This directory is located in MBAM Self-Service Install DirectorySelf Service WebsiteScripts.
segment.target: This directory is located in MBAM Self-Service Install DirectorySelf Service WebsiteScripts.

segment.source: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.
segment.target: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.

segment.source: Expand SitesMicrosoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring, and highlight SelfService.
segment.target: Expand SitesMicrosoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring, and highlight SelfService.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: SelfService is the default virtual directory name.
segment.target: SelfService is the default virtual directory name.

segment.source: If you chose a different name for this directory during installation, remember to replace SelfService in the rest of these instructions with the name you chose.
segment.target: If you chose a different name for this directory during installation, remember to replace SelfService in the rest of these instructions with the name you chose.

segment.source: In the middle pane, double-click Application Settings.
segment.target: In the middle pane, double-click Application Settings.

segment.source: For each item in the following list, edit the application settings to reference the new location by replacing virtual directory with /SelfService/ (or the name you chose during installation).
segment.target: For each item in the following list, edit the application settings to reference the new location by replacing virtual directory with /SelfService/ (or the name you chose during installation).

segment.source: For example, the virtual directory path will be similar to /selfservice/scripts/jquery-1.7.2.min.js.
segment.target: For example, the virtual directory path will be similar to /selfservice/scripts/jquery-1.7.2.min.js.

segment.source: jQueryPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ jQuery-1.7.2.min.js
segment.target: jQueryPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ jQuery-1.7.2.min.js

segment.source: MicrosoftAjaxPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ MicrosoftAjax.js
segment.target: MicrosoftAjaxPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ MicrosoftAjax.js

segment.source: MicrosoftMvcAjaxPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ MicrosoftMvcAjax.js
segment.target: MicrosoftMvcAjaxPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ MicrosoftMvcAjax.js

segment.source: MicrosoftMvcValidationPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ MicrosoftMvcValidation.js
segment.target: MicrosoftMvcValidationPath: /virtual directory/Scripts/ MicrosoftMvcValidation.js

segment.source: To install the Administration and Monitoring Server feature
segment.target: To install the Administration and Monitoring Server feature

segment.source: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Web Services and the Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: MBAM can encrypt the communication between the Web Services and the Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: If you choose the option to encrypt the communication, you are prompted to select the certification authority-provisioned certificate to use for encryption.
segment.target: If you choose the option to encrypt the communication, you are prompted to select the certification authority-provisioned certificate to use for encryption.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example: ServerName) where the Compliance and Audit Database was installed.
segment.target: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example: ServerName) where the Compliance and Audit Database was installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Compliance Status.

segment.source: However, you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: However, you can change the name when you install the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example: ServerName) where the Recovery Database was installed.
segment.target: Specify the remote instance of SQL Server (for example: ServerName) where the Recovery Database was installed.

segment.source: Specify the name of the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Specify the name of the Recovery Database.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware.

segment.source: However, you can change the name when you install the Recovery Database feature.
segment.target: However, you can change the name when you install the Recovery Database feature.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Specify the URL for the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services (SRS) site.
segment.target: Specify the URL for the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services (SRS) site.

segment.source: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance is at:
segment.target: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance is at:

segment.source: http://NameofMBAMReportsServerReportServer
segment.target: http://NameofMBAMReportsServerReportServer

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SQL Server Reporting Services was configured as a named instance, the URL resembles the following: http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportServerSRSInstanceName.
segment.target: If SQL Server Reporting Services was configured as a named instance, the URL resembles the following: http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportServerSRSInstanceName.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Enter the Port Number, the Host Name (optional), and the Installation Path for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: Enter the Port Number, the Host Name (optional), and the Installation Path for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring server unless you specify a unique host header name.
segment.target: The port number that you specify must be an unused port number on the Administration and Monitoring server unless you specify a unique host header name.

segment.source: If you are using Windows Firewall, the port will be opened automatically.
segment.target: If you are using Windows Firewall, the port will be opened automatically.

segment.source: To optionally register a Service Principal Name (SPN) for the Self-Service Portal, select Register this machine’s Service Principal Names (SPN) with Active Directory (Required for Windows Authentication).
segment.target: To optionally register a Service Principal Name (SPN) for the Self-Service Portal, select Register this machine’s Service Principal Names (SPN) with Active Directory (Required for Windows Authentication).

segment.source: If you select this check box, MBAM Setup will not try to register the existing SPNs, and you can manually register the SPN before or after the MBAM installation.
segment.target: If you select this check box, MBAM Setup will not try to register the existing SPNs, and you can manually register the SPN before or after the MBAM installation.

segment.source: For instructions on registering the SPN manually, see Manual SPN Registration.
segment.target: For instructions on registering the SPN manually, see Manual SPN Registration.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Setup wizard.

segment.source: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify whether to use Microsoft Updates to help keep your computer secure, and then click Next.

segment.source: When the selected MBAM feature information is completed, you are ready to start the MBAM installation by using the Setup wizard.
segment.target: When the selected MBAM feature information is completed, you are ready to start the MBAM installation by using the Setup wizard.

segment.source: Click Back to move through the wizard if you have to review or change your installation settings.
segment.target: Click Back to move through the wizard if you have to review or change your installation settings.

segment.source: Click Install to being the installation.
segment.target: Click Install to being the installation.

segment.source: Click Cancel to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Click Cancel to exit the wizard.

segment.source: Setup installs the MBAM features that you selected and notifies you that the installation is finished.
segment.target: Setup installs the MBAM features that you selected and notifies you that the installation is finished.

segment.source: Click Finish to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Click Finish to exit the wizard.

segment.source: To perform post-installation configuration
segment.target: To perform post-installation configuration

segment.source: On the Administration and Monitoring Server, add users to the following local groups to give them access to the features on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: On the Administration and Monitoring Server, add users to the following local groups to give them access to the features on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: MBAM Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group can access the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: MBAM Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group can access the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: All fields in Drive Recovery and Manage TPM are required fields for a Helpdesk User.
segment.target: All fields in Drive Recovery and Manage TPM are required fields for a Helpdesk User.

segment.source: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group have advanced access to the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users: Members of this local group have advanced access to the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: For Advanced Helpdesk Users, only the Key ID field is required in Drive Recovery.
segment.target: For Advanced Helpdesk Users, only the Key ID field is required in Drive Recovery.

segment.source: In Manage TPM, only the Computer Domain field and Computer Name field are required.
segment.target: In Manage TPM, only the Computer Domain field and Computer Name field are required.

segment.source: On the server that hosts Administration and Monitoring Server and the Compliance and Audit Database and on the server that hosts the Compliance and Audit Reports, add users to the following local group to give them access to the Reports feature on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: On the server that hosts Administration and Monitoring Server and the Compliance and Audit Database and on the server that hosts the Compliance and Audit Reports, add users to the following local group to give them access to the Reports feature on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: MBAM Report Users: Members of this local group can access the reports on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: MBAM Report Users: Members of this local group can access the reports on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Identical user or group membership of the MBAM Report Users local group must be maintained on all computers where the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server features, Compliance and Audit Database, and the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed.
segment.target: Identical user or group membership of the MBAM Report Users local group must be maintained on all computers where the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server features, Compliance and Audit Database, and the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed.

segment.source: Validating the MBAM Server Feature Installation
segment.target: Validating the MBAM Server Feature Installation

segment.source: When Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Server feature installation is completed, we recommend that you validate that the installation has successfully set up all the necessary features for MBAM.
segment.target: When Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring Server feature installation is completed, we recommend that you validate that the installation has successfully set up all the necessary features for MBAM.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to confirm that the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring service is functional.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to confirm that the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring service is functional.

segment.source: To validate an MBAM Server installation
segment.target: To validate an MBAM Server installation

segment.source: On each server where an MBAM feature is deployed, open Control Panel, select Programs, and then select Programs and Features.
segment.target: On each server where an MBAM feature is deployed, open Control Panel, select Programs, and then select Programs and Features.

segment.source: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the Programs and Features list.
segment.target: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the Programs and Features list.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To validate the MBAM installation, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.
segment.target: To validate the MBAM installation, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.

segment.source: On the server where the Recovery Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database is installed.
segment.target: On the server where the Recovery Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database is installed.

segment.source: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Compliance Status Database is installed.
segment.target: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Database is installed, open SQL Server Management Studio and verify that the MBAM Compliance Status Database is installed.

segment.source: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed, open a web browser with administrative credentials and browse to the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services site.
segment.target: On the server where the Compliance and Audit Reports are installed, open a web browser with administrative credentials and browse to the “Home” of the SQL Server Reporting Services site.

segment.source: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance can be found is at http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/Reports.aspx.
segment.target: The default Home location of a SQL Server Reporting Services site instance can be found is at http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/Reports.aspx.

segment.source: To find the actual URL, use the Reporting Services Configuration Manager tool and select the instances that were specified during setup.
segment.target: To find the actual URL, use the Reporting Services Configuration Manager tool and select the instances that were specified during setup.

segment.source: Confirm that a reports folder named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring contains a data source called MaltaDataSource and that an en-us folder contains four reports.
segment.target: Confirm that a reports folder named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring contains a data source called MaltaDataSource and that an en-us folder contains four reports.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SQL Server Reporting Services was configured as a named instance, the URL should resemble the following:http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportsSRSInstanceName
segment.target: If SQL Server Reporting Services was configured as a named instance, the URL should resemble the following:http://NameofMBAMReportsServer/ReportsSRSInstanceName

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If SSRS was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL), the URL for the reports will be set to HTTP instead of HTTPS when you install the MBAM Server.
segment.target: If SSRS was not configured to use Secure Socket Layer (SSL), the URL for the reports will be set to HTTP instead of HTTPS when you install the MBAM Server.

segment.source: If you then go to the Administration and Monitoring website and select a report, the following message appears: “Only Secure Content is Displayed.”
segment.target: If you then go to the Administration and Monitoring website and select a report, the following message appears: “Only Secure Content is Displayed.”

segment.source: To show the report, click Show All Content.
segment.target: To show the report, click Show All Content.

segment.source: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring feature is installed, run Server Manager and browse to Roles.
segment.target: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring feature is installed, run Server Manager and browse to Roles.

segment.source: Select Web Server (IIS), and then click Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.
segment.target: Select Web Server (IIS), and then click Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager.

segment.source: In Connections, browse to computername, select Sites, and select Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: In Connections, browse to computername, select Sites, and select Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: Verify that MBAMAdministrationService, MBAMComplianceStatusService, and MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService are listed.
segment.target: Verify that MBAMAdministrationService, MBAMComplianceStatusService, and MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService are listed.

segment.source: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring features and Self-Service Portal are installed, open a web browser with administrative credentials and browse to the following locations to verify that they load successfully.
segment.target: On the server where the Administration and Monitoring features and Self-Service Portal are installed, open a web browser with administrative credentials and browse to the following locations to verify that they load successfully.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The URLs ending in “.svc” do not display a website.
segment.target: The URLs ending in “.svc” do not display a website.

segment.source: Success is indicated by the message “Metadata publishing for this service is currently disabled” or by information resembling code.
segment.target: Success is indicated by the message “Metadata publishing for this service is currently disabled” or by information resembling code.

segment.source: If you see some other error message or if the page cannot be found, the page has not loaded successfully.
segment.target: If you see some other error message or if the page cannot be found, the page has not loaded successfully.

segment.source: http://hostname/HelpDesk/default.aspx and confirm each of the links for navigation and reports
segment.target: http://hostname/HelpDesk/default.aspx and confirm each of the links for navigation and reports

segment.source: http://hostname/SelfService
segment.target: http://hostname/SelfService

segment.source: http://computername/MBAMAdministrationService/AdministrationService.svc
segment.target: http://computername/MBAMAdministrationService/AdministrationService.svc

segment.source: http://hostname/MBAMUserSupportService/UserSupportService.svc
segment.target: http://hostname/MBAMUserSupportService/UserSupportService.svc

segment.source: http://computername/MBAMComplianceStatusService/StatusReportingService.svc
segment.target: http://computername/MBAMComplianceStatusService/StatusReportingService.svc

segment.source: http://computername/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc
segment.target: http://computername/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is assumed that the server features were installed on the default port without network encryption.
segment.target: It is assumed that the server features were installed on the default port without network encryption.

segment.source: If you installed the server features on a different port or virtual directory, change the URLs to include the appropriate port, for example, http://hostname:port/HelpDesk/default.aspx orhttp://hostname:portvirtualdirectory/default.aspx
segment.target: If you installed the server features on a different port or virtual directory, change the URLs to include the appropriate port, for example, http://hostname:port/HelpDesk/default.aspx orhttp://hostname:portvirtualdirectory/default.aspx

segment.source: If the server features were installed with network encryption, change http:// to https://.
segment.target: If the server features were installed with network encryption, change http:// to https://.

segment.source: Verify that each webpage loads successfully.
segment.target: Verify that each webpage loads successfully.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Deploying the MBAM 2.0 Server Infrastructure
segment.target: Deploying the MBAM 2.0 Server Infrastructure
